title: Seoul Bike Share Predictor
text:
In this project, we aimed to build a Docker image from scratch and create a fully reproducible analysis pipeline for future use.
The primary goal was to learn and practice key software engineering tools, including:

Setting up Docker images
Implementing a CI/CD pipeline
Managing environments using Conda
Using make commands for workflow automation
Documenting the project using Quarto

We chose a simple dataset for this project, as the main focus was on understanding software tools rather than complex data modeling.



Rental bikes enhance urban mobility, but predicting their demand is crucial to maintaining a stable supply.
This project uses historical bike rental counts, weather information, and holiday data to forecast hourly bike demand in Seoul.
The dataset was sourced from the UCI Machine Learning Repository and described in studies by Sathishkumar V E, Jangwoo Park, and Yongyun Cho.

title: Lecture RAG Assistant: Conversational Q&A Over Lecture Notes
text:
ğŸ“š Lecture RAG Assistant
Lecture RAG Assistant is a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline for querying lecture notes in .ipynb and .pdf format using a conversational interface powered by LLMs.
It combines the power of LangChain, ChromaDB, HuggingFace Embeddings, and OpenAI models (or local models) to generate accurate, source-grounded answers from your personal lecture material.

title: Lecture RAG Assistant: Conversational Q&A Over Lecture Notes
text:
Project Structure
lecture_rag/
â”œâ”€â”€ app.py               # Streamlit dashboard for Q&A
â”œâ”€â”€ ingest.py            # Extracts & chunks lecture files, saves to ChromaDB
â”œâ”€â”€ qa_pipeline.py       # Loads retriever + LLM to create QA chain
â”œâ”€â”€ lectures/            # Directory with lecture PDFs/Notebooks
â”œâ”€â”€ chroma_langchain_db/ # Persisted vector DB (auto-created)
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md            # Project documentation

title: Lecture RAG Assistant: Conversational Q&A Over Lecture Notes
text:
Setup Instructions

1. Install Dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt
Or install manually:
pip install langchain openai chromadb streamlit sentence-transformers PyMuPDF


2. Ingest Lecture Notes
Put .pdf and/or .ipynb files in the ./lectures/ folder and run:
python ingest.py
This will:

Recursively scan the lecture folder
Chunk the content intelligently
Embed chunks with SentenceTransformers
Save the vector DB in ChromaDB



3. Launch the Q&A Dashboard
streamlit run app.py
Use the web app to:

Ask questions about your lecture content
See grounded responses with source highlighting

title: Lecture RAG Assistant: Conversational Q&A Over Lecture Notes
text:
ğŸ”‘ API Key Setup
To use OpenAI models like gpt-3.5-turbo, set:
export OPENAI_API_KEY="your_openai_key_here"
If no key is found, the app skips LLM inference gracefully.

title: Lecture RAG Assistant: Conversational Q&A Over Lecture Notes
text:
ğŸ§ How It Works

Ingestion (ingest.py)

Loads .ipynb via NotebookLoader, .pdf via PyPDFLoader
Splits text with RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter
Embeds using all-mpnet-base-v2
Stores in a persistent ChromaDB vector store



Retrieval (qa_pipeline.py)

Loads the vector DB as retriever
Wraps LLM and retriever with RetrievalQA from LangChain



Interaction (app.py)

Accepts user question
Fetches relevant chunks
Constructs answer and shows references

title: Vancouver Crime Statistics Dashboard
text:

The extracted data was then processed and used to create this interactive dashboard.
This project helped me learn the basics of Shiny app development and gave me hands-on experience working with real-world data sources.



Crime statistics provide valuable insights into public safety and law enforcement effectiveness.
This dashboard is designed for policymakers, researchers, and local authorities to analyze crime trends across Vancouver neighborhoods.

Track crime trends over time

Compare crime types across neighborhoods

Analyze monthly crime patterns

Filter and explore data by date, location, and type
